thread.title: Alphabet's profit jumps 73 percent in first quarter

title: Alphabet's profit jumps 73 percent in first quarter
text:
April 23, 2018 / 8:10 PM / Updated 32 minutes ago Alphabet's profit jumps 73 percent in first quarter Reuters Staff 1 Min Read 
(Reuters) - Alphabet Inc’s ( GOOGL.O ) profit jumped about 73 percent in the first three months of the year, as Google’s parent company benefited from soaring sales of internet advertisements. FILE PHOTO: A man walks through light rain in front of the Hey Google booth under construction at the Las Vegas Convention Center in preparation for the 2018 CES in Las Vegas, Nevada, U.S. January 8, 2018. REUTERS/Steve Marcus/File Photo 
Alphabet said on Monday first-quarter net income rose to $9.4 billion (£6.75 billion) or $13.33 per Class A and B common share and Class C capital share, from $5.43 billion or $7.73 per share a year earlier. 
Revenue jumped to $31.15 billion from $24.75 billion. Reporting by Arjun Panchadar in Bengaluru; Editing by Sai Sachin Ravikumar
